meanings.definition: To decrease in intensity or importance
meanings.sent1: The excitement pales as the day goes on.
meanings.sent2: His enthusiasm pales in comparison to hers.
meanings.sent3: The color of the sky pales as the sun sets.
meanings.sent4: Her smile pales when she hears the bad news.
meanings.sent5: The beauty of the flower pales in the dim light.

meanings.definition: A wooden stake driven into the ground for a fence
meanings.sent1: The farmer used sturdy pales to build the fence.
meanings.sent2: The old pales marked the boundary of the property.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous dog chewed on the wooden pales.
meanings.sent4: The wind knocked down the loose pales of the fence.
meanings.sent5: The carpenter selected the best pales for the job.

meanings.sent1: The river served as a natural pale for the town.
meanings.sent2: The pale between the two properties was clearly marked.
meanings.sent3: The pale of the forest was where the adventure began.
meanings.sent4: The pale of the law must be respected by all.
meanings.sent5: The pale of the mountain range was visible in the distance.
